text:
Halle Berry Shines in Plunging Metallic Look at “Crime 101 ”Premiere in London
NEED TO KNOW
Halle Berry wore a striking plunging ensemble to the London premiere of Crime 101 on Wednesday, Jan. 28
Berry will star in the film opposite Chris Hemsworth, Mark Ruffalo and Barry Keoghan
The film hits theaters on Feb. 13
Halle Berry wore a striking metallic look to the premiere of Crime 101 in London on Wednesday, Jan. 28.
Berry, 59, wore a black bodysuit with a plunging neckline paired with a silver chainmail-inspired skirt. The actress accessorized the look with a dangling silver floral pendant and eclectic silver rings. She kept warm in a sleek black trench coat fit for the London winter weather. Her shoulder-length brunette hair was styled in loose waves with her bangs framing her face.
The Oscar-winner stars in Crime 101 as "disillusioned insurance broker" Sharon, who unexpectedly crosses paths with "elusive" high-profile thief Davis (Chris Hemsworth), finding themselves forced to work together as a detective (Mark Ruffalo) is hot on their trail, according to a synopsis on IMDb.
"As the multimillion-dollar heist approaches, the line between hunter and hunted begins to blur, and all three are forced to confront the cost of their choices — and the realization that there's no turning back," the synopsis adds.
"I'm real good at reading people," Berry's character tells Hemsworth's as they suss each other out in the trailer. “What have you read about me?” he asks.
Advertisement
“You look like a person who has secrets. You got the cars, the clothes. But can’t seem to look me in the eye,” Berry's character replies.
The trailer shows glimpses of Hemsworth's character's various robberies along L.A.’s 101 freeway, culminating in posing as a driver for Ruffalo, 57 — who drops not-so-subtle hints that he’s onto his old Marvel costar.

Adapted from Don Winslow’s acclaimed novella and co-written by Peter Straughan, Crime 101, set in Los Angeles, also stars Barry Keoghan, Monica Barbaro, Corey Hawkins, Jennifer Jason Leigh and Nick Nolte.
Crime 101 hits theaters on Feb. 13.
